Who We Are: Click Therapeutics, Inc. develops, validates and commercializes software as prescription medical treatments for patients with unmet medical needs. Through cognitive and neurobehavioral mechanisms, Click's Digital Therapeutics™ enable change within individuals, and are designed to be used independently or in conjunction with biomedical treatments. The Clickometrics® adaptive data science platform continuously personalizes user experience to optimize engagement and outcomes. Following a groundbreaking clinical trial, Click's industry-leading smoking cessation program is available nationwide through a wide variety of payers, providers, and employers. Click's lead prescription program has entered a pivotal, fully remote, randomized, controlled trial on the Verily platform for the treatment of Major Depressive Disorder (MDD) in up to 540 adults. Click is progressing a broad pipeline of Digital Therapeutics™ across a variety of high-burden therapeutic areas, including MDD, Schizophrenia, Migraine, Chronic Pain, Atopic Dermatitis, Acute Coronary Syndrome (ACS), Obesity and more.About the Role: We are looking for an experienced Front End Engineer with exceptional ability to build and architect scalable frontend applications. Currently, our focus is on expanding our platform for providing a unified experience for our existing therapeutic applications as well as the new and strategic applications for which we are engineering and clinical validating. We have an expanding list of public, private, and privileged web properties and our software meets our patients on our mobile applications (iOS, Android) which are supported by APIs hosted within our secure virtual private cloud. Although every member of our development team spends most of the time writing code, we are really looking for an engineer who shares our focus on and cares for the success of our product and business, as well as driving life-altering outcomes for our patients. We love to work with engineers who are just as comfortable talking about low-level memory allocation, distributed systems architecture, or how to give aspects of an application a more engaging user experience. Our developers are equal parts user-advocate, architect, problem solver, and coder.Generally positions at Click can be on-site, remote or hybrid (an optimal combination of remote and on-site). Our headquarters is located in Tribeca, NYC, at the center of one of the fastest-growing digital health communities. We also have dedicated spaces in central Miami, San Francisco, and Boston, and, in addition, via our partnership with Industrious, any Click employee can access co-working locations nationally.The role includes great benefits and is an excellent wealth-building opportunity at a fast-growing pre-IPO company in a nascent and extremely exciting space.Responsibilities: 

Responsible for leading and driving experiences for mobile applications and delivering projects in a fast-moving and dynamic environment collaborating with other teams.
Responsible for planning and estimation of the implementation of product requirements.
Influence and mentor other engineers by providing guidance via code reviews, pairing and tech talks to drive a culture of engineering excellence and collaboration.
Drive and contribute to the development of our common component library and Design System.
Partner closely with product owners, engineering leads, managers and UX designers to build experiences users will love.

Qualifications: 

BS. in Computer Science or related field.
5+ years of experience building front end applications.
Experience in development with JavaScript and strong understanding of fundamentals of the modern stack.
Strong knowledge and experience using JavaScript ES6+, CSS 3 and HTML 5. Experience with preprocessors such as SASS and styled components is a big plus.
Experience building mobile applications with frameworks such as React Native preferred or extensive experience with React or other similar frameworks and desire to learn React Native.
Experience with Front End tooling such as setting up and configuring Webpack flows, automated code quality tooling and custom NodeJS scripts.
Experience writing automated tests with tools such as Jest.
Experience creating component libraries or Design Systems with React to build and contribute to our component library.
Comfortable interfacing with backend services within the application.
Familiarity with AWS, Kubernetes, Docker, CircleCI, npm, yarn, and Github.
Comfortable working in an Agile development environment as well as interfacing with cross functional partners in Design and Product.

At Earnest, we believe in a world where paying for your education takes less time than earning your degree. Join us on our mission to empower anyone seeking higher education to reduce the total price tag of their degree, supercharge their ability to pay down student debt, and get on the right financial track fast.
 A little background on Earnest: We're a remote first FinTech company with an accomplished team who believe consumer lending can be radically improved and are doing something about it. We are disrupting the trillion dollar student loan industry by redefining what it means to be creditworthy. We created a company that combines data science, streamlined design, and technology to:

Build products that simplify the lending process
Personalize loans to suit the needs of our customers
Engage with our customers through more human experiences



 What makes an "Earnie" culture:
 Earnest's culture is as dynamic as the products we are building and defining every day. We're a fast-growing company, and that means we're constantly integrating the new perspectives of every individual.
 Earnies define our culture as:

Earn Happy Customers

Our success comes from anticipating their needs and providing the solutions they're looking for.

Better is Better

The path to great means getting better every day. We push ourselves, and each other, to remain curious and think differently.

PhD in Moving Fast

Our customers are tired of long wait times and large student loan bills so we constantly seek out ways to deliver faster.

Passion for Challenges

Perseverance and optimism are just the start to take on the inertia of a national trillion-dollar problem.

Impact is a Team Sport

We maximize our impact when we act as one team.




Our Earnie's are fun, innovative, and willing to rollup their sleeves to help their team succeed in a fast-paced environment. If this sounds like you, and you want to join us on our mission to radically disrupt a trillion dollar fintech industry, keep reading to find out how.
 As a Lead Mobile Software Engineer (Remote) you'll lead the technical direction of mobile engineering to revolutionize consumer lending, automating the loan approval process and orchestrating the transfer of billions of dollars. Our focus is on building an extensible, modern mobile experience platform that allows us to move faster over time. This means a willingness to rethink domains from first principles and an ability to collaborate well across technical and non-technical teams. You will report to the Engineering Manager or Director.


 What you'll do:
 Mobile Software Development

Lead a small team of developers to build highly-rated React Native iOS / Android clients for Earnest products
Opportunity to set the technical vision and lead the implementation of Earnest mobile apps from scratch.
Architect, build and maintain excellent React Native applications with clean code
Implement mobile app UIs that provide an excellent user experience based on designs.
Integrate Earnest with third-party API's.
Write unit and integration tests.
Release applications to the Apple and Google Play stores.
Work with modern tools including Jira, Slack, GitHub etc.

Requirements Analysis

Partner closely with product, analytics, and design team counterparts to build towards a shared vision.
Assist with estimation and planning
Ensure that the team is working on the right product and roadmap items

Mentoring, Coaching and Onboarding Engineers

May lead and mentor one or more Software Engineers
Provide coding and architecture feedback to other engineers using Github or through pair programming.
Onboard new engineers to the team by sharing best practices and keeping team documentation (in Confluence, or Github) up-to-date.

Operational Support

Participate in our devops culture and provide rotating on-call support for production application software system(s) that comprise Earnest's customer facing and internal lending systems. During on-call support the Lead Software Engineer is responsible for responding to system alerts, triaging the problem via Splunk log and dashboard analysis, New Relic system and application monitors and AWS Cloudwatch monitors to determine the severity and priority of the problem. Ultimately the Software Engineer is responsible for either fixing the problem or escalating to other application support teams as appropriate. For mobile apps, the Lead Software Engineer will also be responsible for making sure the apps in the Apple and Google app stores are of high quality and receiving high ratings from users.



 Experiences you will bring with you:

7+ years of software development, preferably developing mobile apps
2+ years of experience leading a small team of developers building mobile apps for iOS and Android using React Native.
3+ years of experience using React Native
Proven track record of building highly-rated mobile apps on Apple and Google app stores
Well versed with development and build tools used with React Native

Other useful skills and experience:

Experience working with FinTech/Financial Services
Experience creating mobile apps from scratch.
Native mobile development experience for iOS and Android

Job Summary: 

Looking for a React Native developer to join the growing Digital Technology Team for At Home Group. 

The React-Native developer will be responsible for the development of the At Home mobile app built for both iOS and Android devices. 

You’ll be working alongside other engineers and developers, collaborating with cross-functional teams to define, design, and ship new features and capabilities in support of At Home’s fast-growing e-commerce business.

Ability to work seamlessly as part of a multi-site, multicultural development team  
Proven ability to work on a cross-functional team

Self-motivated, driven to achieve committed milestones

Strong communication skills  
Working and communicating well within a team environment

Genvid is delivering a brand new form of entertainment combining the best of traditional storytelling with the immersion and interaction of video games. We call this category Massively Interactive Live Events (MILEs).

 Imagine you and a global community of other fans can influence the storyline of your favorite brands, characters and worlds? And it becomes official canon? Another unique aspect of MILEs is fans can choose whether to sit back and enjoy watching dramatic events unfold or lean-in and be critically participatory. And all of this happens live and with millions of other fans. Current projects include Pac-Man Community on Facebook and the upcoming The Walking Dead: Last Mile.

 Genvid Entertainment is also developing a global, scalable direct-to-consumer platform to publish MILEs via multiple platforms - from web browsers, mobile app stores to game consoles and connected TVs. This will allow us to publish globally and meet consumers on any device, wherever they might be.

 Our rapidly growing team is composed of leaders from entertainment, video games, and technology with offices around the world. Genvid is extremely diverse, forward thinking, creative, and collaborative. We solve thorny problems quickly, reinvent the rules when necessary, and take pride in blazing new trails. We operate in 4 states CA, NY, WA and TX.

 Genvid has big ambitions, bold vision, and groundbreaking technology coupled with strong financial backing and partnerships with some of the most beloved franchises in the world. Are you ready to shape the future of entertainment? Join in.
 The Accounts & Commerce team, part of Genvid’s Global Publishing Platform, is hiring foundational team members to develop our commerce and payment management systems to monetize our future MILEs. As our Senior Fullstack Engineer for Commerce, your designs and code will handle billing, payment, virtual currency, provisioning, entitlement, risk, and fraud for millions of fans across consoles, mobile, web, PC, and wherever Genvid’s technology can reach.

 Key Responsibilities

Research, analyze, design, build, scale, and support the technology that fuels Genvid’s monetization strategy.
Build the tools that allow our MILEs teams to sell virtual goods in-game and on the web
Collaborate with product management to rapidly experiment on new ideas and solutions
Build robust libraries, services, and tools that can stand up to malicious actors
Use metrics to track system performance and inform your many design decisions
Contribute creatively to the MILE economy design and development process
Anticipate and foster discussions focused on technical solutions and implementation using the best practices that you’ve learned from your extensive experience.
Mentor developers and share your deep subject matter expertise of payments integrations to raise the technical ceiling of your team.



 Qualifications and Education Requirements

Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or equivalent industry experience.
7+ years experience with game backend development over distributed or cloud environments
Deep expertise with in-app payments functionality, including the nuances between specific consoles (XBox, Playstation, Nintendo), mobile (iOS, Android), and PC/Mac platforms’ approach to processing transactions.
Familiarity with game backend SaaS applications like Playfab, XSolla, and GameSparks.
Experience with integrating secure web services with game engines (i.e. Unity or Unreal)
Fluency in at least one backend programming language (we use Python, C#, C++).
Experience with a JavaScript library/framework (we use React/React Native).
Experience in NoSQL database design and management including schema, interface, and capacity scaling.
Experience building on AWS with deep understanding of containers, serverless, and CI/CD.
Ability to lead without authority, unafraid to take responsibility in order to decrease complexity for others, yet always providing visibility and context.
Track record of demonstrating high-judgment, backed by data and/or experience, to cut through ambiguity and innovate on behalf of the customer.
Strong technical written communication skills (We’re remote and use Slack … a lot!).
Extensive experience working in a high-technical, team-oriented, collaborative environment evidenced through robust relationships across a broad business.
High integrity: trustworthy, self-motivated, self-directed, communicative, and attentive to detail.

Job summary
  Join a nascent developer education team creating learning materials in opensource for frontend and fullstack developers where you will contribute to our documentation and processes across a matrix of platforms and usergroups. Beyond just writing and editing, you will guide our content roadmap with engineers and product managers, define what a great learning experience looks like for our customers, and drive documentation culture across teams.
 
 AWS Amplify is a suite of tools and services spanning web and mobile platforms designed to make it easy and delightful for developers to build apps that run on AWS. The AWS Amplify Developer Education team empowers front end developers to dive into full stack with docs, tutorials, and other educational materials. On this team you will collaborate with key stakeholders to land crucial docs and work with our documentation engineers on the design and content for new learning experiences like interactive learning paths and sample app tutorials. 
 
 Key job responsibilities
 

 Contribute to our documentation
 Lead our information architecture overhaul
 Design learning paths and curricula
 Manage our documentation pipeline and contributions from our team and opensource contributors
 Lead improvements in our documentation process internally and externally
 Raise the bar on documentation quality

 A day in the life
  At AWS Amplify, contribute to our documentation as well as shape its future. Your typical day starts with checking our documentation pipeline for new submissions and status updates, following up with anyone requesting an editorial review. Weekly, you’ll participate in our Discord and documentation office hours to learn more about how people learn, teach, and document Amplify. You will use those learnings to craft our content strategy around our growing matrix of content. Every other week, you lead triaging to ensure the right content is prioritized for the right audience. You are responsible for our information architecture and opensource contributions.
 
 About the team
  AWS Amplify builds delightful developer experiences that enable a growing community of hundreds of thousands of frontend, fullstack, and mobile developers around the world to build and launch their dreams, from startup to scaling up. We are remotely distributed across the USA and around the world with in-person offices in Seattle, New York City, and San Diego. We have startup vibes yet maintain work-life balance. This team works closely with Amplify’s developer advocacy team, product marketing team, and open source teams. The documentation team believes that the people who write the code have the most to teach future developers, and we bring that knowledge to the community.

Wavely Diagnostics is expanding access to pediatric care via a portfolio of phone-based medical diagnostics. We are at the forefront of the new digital diagnostics industry, and your work will help shape this emerging space. Our first product is an app that can detect fluid in the middle ear, reducing barriers to accurately diagnosing ear infections. We are a fast-paced, very early startup and are working towards our first commercial launch.
Our development team requires a Cloud Developer with familiarity working in a a regulated environment that requires some degree of compliance (e.g. healthcare, finance, etc.). This mid- or senior level Developer should be familiar with Cloud (Azure .Net, C#), Data Science DB’s, Backend Development, API development, Machine Learning, integration with Mobile (iOS / Android via Swift and Kotlin) and ideally MATLab. The candidate will join our small, agile team and be primarily responsible for the APIs and functions that connect data and machine learning in the Cloud, as well as the websites and integrations necessary to support our business. The position requires strong systematic thinking and communication skills. The candidate will be a key member of the team that delivers a robust product to market.
We are looking for people who love to learn, can wear multiple hats, are detail oriented and will thrive in a fast-paced startup environment. We expect people to work independently in their domain, while also collaborating effectively with cross-functional teams. Successful execution will lead to significant career growth for the right individual. Please bring your passion about expanding healthcare for kids and be ready to demonstrate your skill in delivering robust, stage-appropriate software in a regulated space.
Key responsibilities will include:

Design, develop and implement technical solutions in Microsoft Azure environments using .NET stack, ASP, Web API using Azure database objects, SQL, Functions, Services, and Web/API Apps


Plan/Execute development of new RESTful Web Services


Develop highly interactive web applications using technologies like JavaScript, React, Node, Python, and PostgreSQL from requirements gathering to design, development, testing, and maintenance


Create technical design recommendations for the development and integration of new software and system technologies


Design Cloud architecture using big data technologies (Hadoop, Spark, Cassandra), and container technologies (Docker and Kubernetes)


Analyze, design, build and test cloud based solutions


Ensure cloud infrastructure meets compliance requirements such as HIPAA


Document APIs and technical work as required by partners and regulatory agencies


Participate in the assessment of the customer environment and requirements

Technical/Functional Skills

Application stack ADF, APIM, app services, API services, micro services, event based and message-based frameworks.


Familiarly with storage mechanisms (ADLS, blob, tables, SQL, No-SQL)


Familiar with Infrastructure concerns like scalability, high availability, gateways, load balancers, traffic manager, replication techniques.


Comprehensive understanding of authorization, authentication, on-premise AD integration, and synchronization with Azure AD.


Understanding of standard methodologies around caching, encryption, hashing on applications and data.


Hands-on experience in designing and developing micro-service-based applications using .NET Core, cloud native applications, and moving to commercial cloud (such as Azure).


Familiarity with web services:  REST, SOAP (nice to have)


Familiarity with other tools including Git on Azure DevOps

Required Qualifications

Expertise in .Net with 5+ years of professional experience


Bachelor’s degree in computer science/engineering, signal processing, or equivalent 5+ years of software engineering experience


Proficiency in developing solutions with cloud platforms like Azure, AWS, GCP


Experience with SaMD (Software as a Medical Device) or building products in other regulated industries that must be compliant with relevant regulations


Experience with documenting technical work


Strong verbal and written communication skills


Excellent problem-solving abilities

Preferred Qualifications

Experience building complex mission-critical systems that have been successfully delivered to customers at scale


Knowledge of engineering practices and patterns for the full /hardware/software life cycle, including coding standards, version control systems, code reviews, source management, build processes, testing and livesite operations


Experience with Machine Learning, Data Sciences, and its application to Audio Data

Job Title: Senior Mobile Engineer - Emerging Products Group
Job Description:
Our Company 

 Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. 

 We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! 

 Passionate about mobile photography and AI? This is your opportunity to work with a team that will be changing the camera industry. 

 Adobe's EPG (Emerging Product Group) is seeking a senior Mobile Developer to join our team in San Jose, California. You will part of the core team that is exploring next-generation product opportunities centered around the concept of a universal camera app, and empowered by machine learning, computer vision, and computational photography. The effort will begin as part of our Photoshop Camera app, growing its photographic collection capabilities in new directions. If successful it will grow to become a technology platform for other Adobe products, with the opportunity for broad impact. 

 If you are passionate about mobile photography and AI this is your opportunity to work with a truly great team on some really exciting projects. 

 What you’ll do 
Our team works like a startup inside Adobe, making this is a unique “best of both worlds” opportunity. If you’d love the flexibility and personal impact of joining an exciting startup but also dream of having the deep resources, cool perks and global launch stage that only an industry leader like Adobe can offer, this is where you belong. 
You’ll have strong input on the direction of this new product category while working directly with the experienced startup entrepreneurs leading this project. 
You’ll lead the iOS projects to guide a high performing team. 
Develop, implement, test, deploy, and support our mobile app on iOS and/or Android. 
Understanding of core CS including data structures, algorithms and concurrent programming 
Collaborate with our designers, product managers, researchers and visual effects engineers. 
Make an impact while building a rewarding career at a new growing division within Adobe 

 What you need to succeed 
10+ years of industrial experience in developing large applications. 
B.S. or M.S. in Computer Science or equivalent. 
3+ years iOS development experience and Android development experience as a plus. 
Proficient in Objective-C, Xcode, C, and C++, are required and Android Studio is a plus 
Proficient in Swift is a plus 
Knowledge of GPU and Image/Video Processing, and experience in iOS and/or Android camera capture pipeline as a plus.

As a lead framework developer, you will be responsible for developing concepts, patterns, APIs and roadmaps for the JPMorgan Chase mobile framework. You will bring industry best practices, new ideas, and recommendations to the strategic planning and direction of the mobile applications while also taking into consideration performance, security, and experience. 
 
 You will also be required to document and illustrate framework capabilities, APIs, developer guide and present them for review and approval, and authoritatively support them through implementation and deployment phases, making adjustments to the approaches as challenges arise. 
 

Responsibilities: 


Design framework solutions, patterns and APIs. Ensure that design is robust, extensible and follows best practices. 
Develop framework using Swift, objective-C, and open source libraries. Ensure code adheres to industry coding best practices 
Develop framework systems using agile software development methodology. Participate in daily meetings. Contribute towards entire Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC) of upcoming projects 
Create Unit Tests, Perform Integration Tests to verify that developed software meets the requirements. Validate deployed code to ensure that it works as expected. 
Design and develop tooling and solution to aid the software testing and debugging 
Work with mobile application team to setup monitoring, and resolve production issues/crashes. Assist with troubleshooting, root cause analysis and ensure that software bugs are corrected in an expedient manner. Communicate resolution & next steps. 
Assist with performance monitoring, root cause analysis of performance bottlenecks and resolutions. Measure application performance using memory profiling, thread analysis and heap analysis. 
Test and troubleshoot application running on devices 
Assess and apply industry best practices, new ideas, and recommendations to the strategic planning and direction of the mobile applications while also taking into consideration performance, security, and experience. 

Qualifications:  

Bachelor's Degree or equivalent work experience 


5+ years of iOS development experience using Swift, Objective-C, Xcode and open source libraries 
3+ years of experience with mobile testing - unit test, automation test, testing/debugging using emulator and device 
3+ years of experience with mobile application profiling for memory analysis, thread analysis and heap analysis 
3+ years of experience with reusable iOS framework or component development 
Excellent written and verbal communication skills - design and APIs documentations 
3+ experience with mobile build configuration and dependency management system

Location: Hybrid remote in San Diego, CA 92122
Job Description:
Senior iOS Developer
Job Description
OVERVIEW Homes.com offers today's demanding home buyers, renters, and those somewhere in between a simply smarter home search. With features like Homes.com Match, HomeShare and Snap & Search, homeshoppers now have a more personalized way to search for their next home. Since its launch over 25 years ago, Homes.com offers real estate professionals’ brand and property advertising, search engine marketing and instant response lead generation to help them succeed online. This position can sit in either our Irvine, CA or DC office and has the opportunity for hybrid work with up to two days remote per week. Four-day work weeks are also an option for those applicants that are interested. Our Irvine, CA team is seeking an accomplished iOS Engineer to join our team in supporting the supporting multiple software products and brands across the organization, such as www.homes.com and www.homesnap.com. You will have a direct impact on highly visible Homes web applications that touch millions of users. You continuously learn emerging technologies and architecture advancements and apply the learnings to improve Homes’ software products RESPONSIBILITIES You will develop iOS applications that scale to reach millions of users You will continually evaluate emerging technologies to identify opportunities, trends, and best practices that can be used to strengthen CoStar’s technology platform and development practices Work with the team to create user interface layouts for customers and interfaces to backend web services Design and develop systems and libraries that are highly reusable and maintainable Understand CoStar’s product architecture and frameworks and come to the table with your ideas Collaborate with different teams along with other iOS developers to exchange new ideas and improvements BASIC QUALIFICATIONS You hold a Bachelor’s degree in computer science or related field 5+ years’ experience in developing iOS applications You are an expert in everything iOS - Objective C , Swift, Cocoa Framework, XCode IDE, Interface Builder and are always interested in learning more and sharing your skills You know all the common Object Oriented Programming and design patterns, MVC, MVVM, Dependency Injection and more. You have 1+ years experience mentoring and leading a team PREFERRED QUALIFCATIONS AND SKILLS Experience with SQL databases and full stack development You love mobile applications and know how to make them engaging You understand how to turn ideas and code into the perfect customer experience OVERVIEW OF COMPANY: Founded in 1987, CoStar Group is the leading provider of commercial real estate information, analytics, and online marketplaces. Our suite of online services enables clients to analyze, interpret and gain unmatched insight on commercial property values, market conditions and current availability. Behind some of the most well-known brands in the industry, CoStar Group includes CoStar, the largest provider of CRE research and real-time data; LoopNet, the most heavily trafficked mobile and online real estate marketplace; Apartments.com, the premier rental home resource for renters, property managers and owners; STR, the leading provider of performance benchmarking and comparative analytics to the hotel industry; BizBuySell, the largest online marketplace for businesses-for-sales; and Lands of America, the leading operator of online marketplaces for rural real estate.
